Element.Name: Specification identifier
Element.Description: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.

Element.Name: Business process type
Element.Description: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears, to enable the Buyer to process the Invoice in an appropriate way.

Element.Name: Invoice number
Element.Description: A unique identification of the Invoice. The sequential number required in Article 226(2) of the directive 2006/112/EC [2], to uniquely identify the Invoice within the business context, time-frame, operating systems and records of the Seller. No identification scheme is to be used.

Element.Name: Invoice issue date
Element.Description: The date when the Invoice was issued. Format "YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: Payment due date
Element.Description: The date when the payment is due.Format "YYYY-MM-DD". In case the Amount due for payment (BT-115) is positive, either the Payment due date (BT-9) or the Payment terms (BT-20) shall be present.

Element.Name: Invoice type code
Element.Description: A code specifying the functional type of the Invoice.

Element.Name: Invoice note
Element.Description: A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice as a whole.Such as the reason for any correction or assignment note in case the invoice has been factored.

Element.Name: Value added tax point date
Element.Description: The date when the VAT becomes accountable for the Seller and for the Buyer in so far as that date can be determined and differs from the date of issue of the invoice, according to the VAT directive.This element is required if the Value added tax point date is different from the Invoice issue date.

Element.Name: Invoice currency code
Element.Description: The currency in which all Invoice amounts are given, except for the Total VAT amount in accounting currency. Only one currency shall be used in the Invoice, except for the VAT accounting currency code (BT-6) and the invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111).

Element.Name: VAT accounting currency code
Element.Description: The currency used for VAT accounting and reporting purposes as accepted or required in the country of the Seller. Shall be used in combination with the Invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111), when the VAT accounting currency code differs from the Invoice currency code.

Element.Name: Buyer accounting reference
Element.Description: BEAst: Can be used for natural account or code string Peppol: A textual value that specifies where to book the relevant data into the Buyer's financial accounts.

Element.Name: Buyer reference
Element.Description: An identifier assigned by the Buyer used for internal routing purposes. An invoice must have buyer reference or purchase order reference (BT-13).

Element.Name: DELIVERY OR INVOICE PERIOD
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information on the invoice period. Also called delivery period. If the group is used, the invoiceing period start date and/or end date must be used.

Element.Name: Invoicing period start date
Element.Description: The date when the Invoice period starts. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD".

Element.Name: Invoicing period end date
Element.Description: The date when the Invoice period ends. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD".

Element.Name: Value added tax point date code
Element.Description: The code of the date when the VAT becomes accountable for the Seller and for the Buyer.

Element.Name: Purchase order reference
Element.Description: An identifier of a referenced purchase order, issued by the Buyer. An invoice must have buyer reference (BT-10) or purchase order reference. In cases where sales order reference is provided, but there's no purchase order reference, then use value "NA" as this element is mandatory in UBL.

Element.Name: Sales order reference
Element.Description: An identifier of a referenced sales order, issued by the Seller. In cases where sales order reference is provided, but there's no purchase order reference, then set cac:OrderReference/cbc:ID to value "NA" as this element is mandatory in UBL.

Element.Name: PRECEDING INVOICE REFERENCE
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information on one or more preceding Invoices.

Element.Name: Preceding Invoice number
Element.Description: The identification of an Invoice that was previously sent by the Seller.

Element.Name: Preceding Invoice issue date
Element.Description: The date when the Preceding Invoice was issued.Shall be provided in case the Preceding Invoice identifier is not unique. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD".

Element.Name: Despatch advice reference
Element.Description: An identifier of a referenced despatch advice.

Element.Name: Receiving advice reference
Element.Description: An identifier of a referenced receiving advice.

Element.Name: Tender or lot reference
Element.Description: The identification of the call for tender or lot the invoice relates to.

Element.Name: Contract reference
Element.Description: The identification of a contract.

Element.Name: Project reference
Element.Description: The identification of the project the invoice refers to.

Element.Name: PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about the payment.

Element.Name: Payment means type code
Element.Description: The means, expressed as code, for how a payment is expected to be or has been settled.

Attribute.Name: Payment means text
Attribute.Description: The means, expressed as text, for how a payment is expected to be or has been settled.

Element.Name: Remittance information
Element.Description: A textual value used to establish a link between the payment and the Invoice, issued by the Seller. Used for creditor's critical reconciliation information. This information element helps the Seller to assign an incoming payment to the relevant payment process.

Element.Name: PAYMENT CARD INFORMATION
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about card used for payment contemporaneous with invoice issuance.

Element.Name: Payment card primary account number
Element.Description: The Primary Account Number (PAN) of the card used for payment.In accordance with card payments security standards, an invoice should never include a full card primary account number.
Syntax required element not related to a business term.

Element.Name: Payment card holder name
Element.Description: The name of the payment card holder.

Element.Name: CREDIT TRANSFER
Element.Description: A group of business terms to specify credit transfer payments.

Element.Name: Payment account identifier
Element.Description: A unique identifier of the financial payment account, at a payment service provider, to which payment should be made. Such as IBAN or BBAN.

Element.Name: Payment account name
Element.Description: The name of the payment account, at a payment service provider, to which payment should be made.

Element.Name: Payment service provider identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for the payment service provider where a payment account is located. Such as a BIC or a national clearing code where required. No identification scheme Identifier to be used.

Element.Name: DIRECT DEBIT
Element.Description: A group of business terms to specify a direct debit.

Element.Name: Mandate reference identifier
Element.Description: Unique identifier assigned by the Payee for referencing the direct debit mandate. Used in order to pre-notify the Buyer of a SEPA direct debit.

Element.Name: Debited account identifier
Element.Description: The account to be debited by the direct debit.

Element.Name: Payment terms
Element.Description: A textual description of the payment terms that apply to the amount due for payment (Including description of possible penalties). In case the Amount due for payment (BT-115) is positive, either the Payment due date (BT-9) or the Payment terms (BT-20) shall be present.

Element.Name: INVOICE LINE
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information on individual Invoice lines.

Element.Name: Invoice line identifier
Element.Description: A unique identifier for the individual line within the Invoice.

Element.Name: Invoice line note
Element.Description: A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice line.

Element.Name: Invoiced quantity
Element.Description: The quantity of items (goods or services) that is charged in the Invoice line.

Attribute.Name: Invoiced quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the invoiced quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Name: Invoice line net amount
Element.Description: The total amount of the Invoice line. The amount is “net” without VAT, i.e. inclusive of line level allowances and charges as well as other relevant taxes. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals.

Element.Name: Invoice line Buyer accounting reference
Element.Description: A textual value that specifies where to book the relevant data into the Buyer's financial accounts.

Element.Name: Referenced purchase order line reference
Element.Description: An identifier for a referenced line within a purchase order, issued by the Buyer.

Element.Name: Invoice line object identifier
Element.Description: An identifier for an object on which the invoice line is based, given by the Seller.

Attribute.Name: Invoice line object identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Invoice line object identifier.

Element.Name: Document type code
Element.Description: Code "130" MUST be used to indicate an invoice object reference. Not used for other additional documents

Element.Name: INVOICE LINE PERIOD
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about the period relevant for the Invoice line.

Element.Name: Invoice line period start date
Element.Description: The date when the Invoice period for this Invoice line starts. Format ="YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: Invoice line period end date
Element.Description: The date when the Invoice period for this Invoice line ends. Format ="YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: INVOICE LINE ALLOWANCES OR CHARGES
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about allowances or charges applicable to the individual Invoice line.
Use “true” when informing about Charges and “false” when informing about Allowances

Element.Name: Line level allowance or charge reason code
Element.Description: The reason for the line level allowance or charge, expressed as a code.

Element.Name: Line level allowance or charge reason
Element.Description: The reason for the line level allowance or charge, expressed as text.

Element.Name: Line level allowance or charge percentage
Element.Description: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the line level allowance base amount, to calculate the line level allowance or charge amount.

Element.Name: Line level allowance or charge amount
Element.Description: The amount of an allowance or a charge, without VAT. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals

Element.Name: Line level allowance or charge base amount
Element.Description: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the line level allowance or charge percentage, to calculate the line level allowance or charge amount. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals

Element.Name: ITEM INFORMATION
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about the goods and services invoiced.

Element.Name: Item description
Element.Description: A description for an item.The item description allows for describing the item and its features in more detail than the Item name.
Element.Value: Long description of the item on the invoice line

Element.Name: Item name
Element.Description: A name for an item.

Element.Name: Item Buyer's identifier
Element.Description: An identifier, assigned by the Buyer, for the item.

Element.Name: Item Seller's identifier
Element.Description: An identifier, assigned by the Seller, for the item.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: An item identifier based on a registered scheme.

Attribute.Name: Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier

Element.Name: Item country of origin
Element.Description: The code identifying the country from which the item originates.

Element.Name: Item classification identifier
Element.Description: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature.

Attribute.Name: Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier

Attribute.Name: Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier

Element.Name: LINE VAT INFORMATION
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about the VAT applicable for the goods and services invoiced on the Invoice line.

Element.Name: Invoiced item VAT category code
Element.Description: The VAT category code for the invoiced item.

Element.Name: Invoiced item VAT rate
Element.Description: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the invoiced item.
Mandatory element. Use “VAT”

Element.Name: ITEM ATTRIBUTES
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.

Element.Name: Item attribute name
Element.Description: The name of the attribute or property of the item.

Element.Name: Item attribute value
Element.Description: The value of the attribute or property of the item.

Element.Name: PRICE DETAILS
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about the price applied for the goods and services invoiced on the Invoice line.

Element.Name: Item net price
Element.Description: The price of an item, exclusive of VAT, after subtracting item price discount. The Item net price has to be equal with the Item gross price less the Item price discount, if they are both provided. Item price can not be negative.

Element.Name: Item price base quantity
Element.Description: The number of item units to which the price applies.

Attribute.Name: Item price base quantity unit of measure code
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the Item price base quantity, must be the same as the unit code of the Invoiced/credited quantity. Codes for unit of packaging from UNECE Recommendation No. 21 can be used in accordance with the descriptions in the "Intro" section of UN/ECE Recommendation 20, Revision 11 (2015): The 2 character alphanumeric code values in UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be used. To avoid duplication with existing code values in UNECE Recommendation No. 20, each code value from UNECE Recommendation 21 shall be prefixed with an “X”, resulting in a 3 alphanumeric code when used as a unit of measure.

Element.Description: Mandatory element. Value must be “false”

Element.Name: Item price discount
Element.Description: The total discount subtracted from the Item gross price to calculate the Item net price.

Element.Name: Item gross price
Element.Description: The unit price, exclusive of VAT, before subtracting Item price discount, can not be negative
